body:
@urielka - Please read discussions at:  #11356 - and - https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/11345#issuecomment-20573490 - it is explained there. Test it yourself to see why both rewinds are necessary and to also see why a rewind needs to occur in ActionDispatch::request#raw_post before @env['RAW_POST_DATA'] is set.




________________________________
 From: Uriel Katz <notifications@github.com>
To: rails/rails <rails@noreply.github.com> 
Cc: Adrien Lamothe <alamoz@yahoo.com> 
Sent: Monday, July 8, 2013 10:11 AM
Subject: Re: [rails] Fix request raw_post_body.rewind in actionpack-4.0.0/lib/action_dispatch/http/request.rb (#11357)
 


There is a rewind there already (after the read) do you want both?
I don't think that this is the problem, the real problem (IMHO) is accessing the request.body directly when you do that you bypass raw_post and therefore bypass the @env['RAW_POST_DATA']
Also I don't think that doing rewind if rewind exists is a good practice,what are the cases that body doesn't have rewind? I suspect that if body is a raw socket then it won't have rewind...
—
